Property.name: MAINEFFECTS
Property.description: Specifies whether to include main effects only. If No is selected, then two-way or higher order interaction between spline basis functions are included.

Property.name: MAXORDER
Property.description: Specifies higher order interaction.

Property.name: IFKEEPEFFECTS
Property.description: Specifies whether to include main effects only. If No is selected, then two-way or higher order interaction between spline basis functions are included.

Property.name: KeepEffects
Property.description: Specifies a list of variables to be included in the final model.

Option.name: IntervalWhereClause
Option.value: where (ROLE ='INPUT' and USE IN ('D','Y')) or (ROLE='REJECTED' and USE IN ('Y'))

Option.name: ClassWhereClause
Option.value: where ((ROLE ='INPUT' and USE IN ('D','Y')) or (ROLE='REJECTED' and USE IN ('Y')) ) and LEVEL ne 'INTERVAL'

Property.name: IFNOTRANSFORM
Property.description: Specifies whether to include only main effects only. If No is selected, then two-way or higher order interaction between spline basis functions are included.

Property.name: NoTransform
Property.description: Specifies a list of variables to be considered without nonparametric transformation. Variables should appear in the linear form if they are selected.

Option.name: IntervalWhereClause
Option.value: where (ROLE ='INPUT' and USE IN ('D','Y')) or (ROLE='REJECTED' and USE IN ('Y'))

Option.name: ClassWhereClause
Option.value: where ((ROLE ='INPUT' and USE IN ('D','Y')) or (ROLE='REJECTED' and USE IN ('Y')) ) and LEVEL ne 'INTERVAL'

Property.name: NOMISS
Property.description: Specifies whether to exclude missing from train data.

Property.name: MAXBASIS
Property.description: Uses default the maximum number of basis functions in the final model or specifies in the Maximum Basis Number property. Default is the larger value between 21 and one plus two times the number of non-intercept effects specified in the MODEL statement.

Property.name: MAXBASISNUM
Property.description: Specifies the number of maximum number of basis functions that can be used in the final model

Property.name: DF
Property.description: Specifies the degree of freedom. Larger value of degree of freedom lead to fewer spline knots and thus smoother function estimates.

Property.name: ALPHA
Property.description: Specifies the number of knots considered for each variable. The value must be from 0 to 1.

Property.name: PENALTY
Property.description: Specifies the penalty for increasing number of variables in the multivariate adaptive regression spline model.

Property.name: DISTRIBUTION
Property.description: Specifies the probability distribution of Generalized Linear Model. Normal is for interval target by default, Binary for classification if character variable.

Property.name: LINK
Property.description: Specifies the link function of Generalized Linear Model. The default link function for Normal distribution is Identity, and Logit is for Binary distribution.

Property.name: TECH
Property.description: Specifies the optimization technique to obtain maximum likelihood estimates for non-normal distributions.

Property.name: HESS
Property.description: Specifies the Hessian matrix type used in the optimization of likelihood functions, if the Newton-Raphson technique is used. EXPECTED requests that the Hessian matrix in optimization be computed as the negative of the expected information matrix; OBSERVED requests that the Hessian matrix in optimization be computed as the negative of the observed information matrix.

Property.name: MAXITER
Property.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations in the optimization process. The default values are depending on the optimization technique. The default is 50 for Trust-region optimization, Newton-Raphson optimization with ridging and Newton-Raphson optimization; the default is 200 for quasi-Newton optimization and Double-dogleg optimization; the default is 400 for Conjugate-gradient optimization; the default is 1000 for Nelder-Mead simplex optimization.

Property.name: MAXFUNC
Property.description: Specifies the maximum number of function calls in the optimization process. The default values are depending on the optimization technique. The default is 125 for Trust-region optimization, Newton-Raphson optimization with ridging and Newton-Raphson optimization; the default is 500 for quasi-Newton optimization and Double-dogleg optimization; the default is 1000 for Conjugate-gradient optimization; the default is 3000 for Nelder-Mead simplex optimization.

Property.name: MAXTIME
Property.description: Specifies an upper limit of CPU time for the optimization process. By default, CPU time is not limited.

Property.name: MINITER
Property.description: Specifies the minimum number of iterations.

Property.name: ABSCONV
Property.description: Specifies an absolute function convergence criterion. The default value is the negative square root of the largest double-precision value, which serves only as a protection against overflows.

Property.name: ABSFCONV
Property.description: Specifies an absolute function difference convergence criterion.

Property.name: ABSGCONV
Property.description: Specifies an absolute gradient difference convergence criterion.

Property.name: FCONV
Property.description: Specifies an relative function convergence criterion.

Property.name: GCONV
Property.description: Specifies an relative gradient convergence criterion.

Property.name: SELECTION
Property.description: Specifies the method of selection process. The default algorithm of MARS contains two stages: forward selection and backward selection. During the forward selection process, bases are created from interactions between existing parent bases and nonparametric transformation of continuous or classification variables as candidate effects. After the model grows to a certain size, the backward selection process begins by deleting selected based. The deletion continues until the null model is reached, and then the overall best model is chosen based on some goodness-of-fit criterion. The Forward Only selection skips the backward selection step after forward selection is finished.

Property.name: FAST
Property.description: The fast algorithm improves the speed of the forward selection by tuning several parameters.

Property.name: BETA
Property.description: Specifies the 'aging' factor in the priority queue of candidate parent bases. Larger values of beta result in low-improvement parents rising fast into top list of candidates.

Property.name: H
Property.description: Specifies the parameter that controls how ften the improvement is recomputed for a parent basis over all candidate variables. Larger values of h cause fewer computations of improvement.

Property.name: CROSSVALID
Property.description: Cross Validation

Property.name: NFOLD
Property.description: Specifies the number of cross validation fold.

Property.name: SEED
Property.description: Specifies the seed to start the pseudorandom number generator for random cross validation. Default seed is generated from the time of day, which is read from the computer's clock.

Property.name: SEEDNUM
Property.description: Specifies the seed to start the pseudorandom number generator for randon cross validation. If 0 is specified, the seed is generated from the time of day, which is read from the computer's clock.

Property.name: THREADS
Property.description: Specifies the number of threads for analytic computations. If not specified, the number of threads is determined based on the data size and then number of CPUs on the host. Or if the specified number of threads is more than the number of actual CPUs, the node by default sets the value to the number of actual CPUs

Property.name: EXCLUDEDVARIABLE
Property.description: Specifies what action should be taken for variables excluded from the final model. This option is only in effect when using a variable selection method. When set to None, the role of these variables remain unchanged. When set to Hide, these variables are dropped from the metadata exported by the node. When set to Reject, the role of these variables are set to REJECTED.

Property.name: OUTPUT
Property.description: Specifies whether to create a data set that contains the design matrix of constructed basis functions.

Property.name: OUTDESIGN
Property.description: Specifies the selected model to produce the design matrix.

SubGroup.name: SplineOptions
SubGroup.description: Specifies the options for spline function
